intro: Hieracium jaeredense, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in late summer, and the plant is known for its hairy stems and leaves. Hieracium jaeredense is often found in open meadows and slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil in high-altitude environments.
